transcript.title: FOR PRESS: P.M.NO. 86/1963 ELECTION CAMPAIGN ITINERARY - 1963 STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, RT. HON. SIR ROBERT MENZIES
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS P. M. No. 86/ 1963
ELECTION CAMPAIGN ITINERARY 1963
Statement by the Prime Minister, Rt. Hon. Sir Robert Menzies
The Prime Minister ( Sir Robert Menzies) today
released his itinerary for the forthcoming Election Campaign.
It is as follows
November
Tuesday, 12thPolicy Speech T. V. and Radio
All States 8.30 p. m.
Wednesday, 13th Kew City Hall Public Meeting
Thursday, 14th
Friday, 15th
Saturday, 16th
Sunday, 17th
Monday. 18th
Tuesday, 19th
Thursday, 21st
Friday, 22nd
Saturday, 23rd
Sunday, 24th
Monday, 25th Festival Hall,
Brisbane Public Meeting
Ashfield Town Public Meeting
' Hall 8 p. m.
8 p. m.
-8p. m.
Leave Sydney for Perth
In Perth
Forrest Place, Public Meeting
Perth Town Hall,
Adelaide Hobart Essendon
Dandenong Town Hall Public Meeting
Public Meeting
Women's Rally
Public Meeting
St. Charles Hall
Waverley7 NSWWomen's Rally 1 p. m.
1 p. m.
8 p. m.
3 p. m.
8 p. m.
2.30 p. m.
Sydney Brisbane City Youth Rally
Hall
Rockhampton
Tuesday, 26th Public Meeting
Oakleigh ( Vic.)
Town Hall Public Meeting
Wednesday, 27th Hall
Hornsby
Thursday, 28th Moonee Ponds
Town Hall Public Meeting
Public Meeting 1 p. m.
8 p. m.
8 p. m.
8 p. m.
8 p. m.
Friday, 29thMelbourne
Saturday, 30th Melbourne( Polling Day)
In addition to the above items, the Prime Minister will make
a number of television appearances and radio broadcasts
throughout Australia.
CANBERRA, October, 1963.
